benchmark_details.name: ClassEval-T: Evaluating Large Language Models in Class-Level Code Translation
benchmark_details.overview: ClassEval-T is a class-level code translation benchmark designed to assess the performance of large language models (LLMs) on translating complex class structures in code across multiple programming languages such as Python, Java, and C++. It provides a more accurate evaluation of LLM capabilities in real-world software development tasks compared to previous benchmarks focused on statement or method-level translations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating the performance of large language models in translating complex, class-level coding tasks.

data.source: Manually constructed from the ClassEval benchmark via line-wise translation

methodology.calculation: CSR is the ratio of successfully compiled code samples; CA is the ratio of translated programs producing the same execution result as the ground truths.
methodology.interpretation: Higher CSR and CA values indicate better performance in code translation tasks.
methodology.validation: Manually reviewed by experts and evaluations are conducted on zero-shot translation settings.
